Original title: The Host

Cast: Saoirse Ronan, Diane Kruger, Jake Abel, Max Irons, Frances Fisher, William Hurt, Chandler Canterbury, Boyd Holbrook, Stephen Rider, Scott Lawrence, David House, Jaylen Moore
Rating: Not recommended for children under 12 years

Synopsis:
Our world has been invaded by an unknown enemy. Humans have become guests of the invaders who have taken over their minds keeping the body intact. Most of humanity has succumbed to this invasion. When Melanie (Saoirse Ronan), one of the few humans 'wild' left, looks captured, is convinced that his end has come. Wanderer, the "soul" invasive body assigned to Melanie, you are advised of the difficulties of living inside a human: uncontrollable emotions, the stream of sensations, memories too vivid ...

But there is something that Wanderer did not: the former tenant of her body refusing to cede control of his mind.

When external forces compel Wanderer and Melanie to ally, both embark on a dangerous and uncertain search for the man they love.

Production notes:
'The Host (The Host)' is the first installment of the new romantic saga from the author of "Twilight," Stephenie Meyer. The young actress Oscar nominee Saoirse Ronan of Atonement gives life to new romantic heroine after starring Hannah and is accompanied by Diane Kruger, Max Irons, Jake Abel, and William Hurt among others. The film is directed by Andrew Niccol, Gattaca and In charge of time.
